ai-ud4.2:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kusinārā, in the Mallas’ Sal Wood.
ai-ud4.2:1.3_0: Now at that time several mendicants were staying not far from the Buddha in a wilderness hut not far from the Buddha, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, loose-tongued, unmindful, lacking situational awareness and immersion, with straying minds and undisciplined faculties.
ai-ud4.2:2.1_0: The Buddha saw those mendicants staying nearby.
ai-ud4.2:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud4.2:5.1_0: So you should protect your mind,
ai-ud4.2:5.3_0: and right view at the fore.
ai-ud4.2:5.6_0: they’ve given up all bad destinations.”
